Code 
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import geopandas as gpd

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.ticker import FuncFormatter
import seaborn as sns

from PIL import Image

colors = ["#040404", "#7118c1", "#5c5c5c", "#ecebec", "#9357c6", "#3f0d6c"]
logo = Image.open('logo.png')
data = pd.read_excel('clean_data/border_stats.xlsx', sheet_name=None)
Code 
# Load North America shapefile
world = gpd.read_file(gpd.datasets.get_path('naturalearth_lowres'))

# Filter for North America countries
north_america = world[(world['continent'] == 'North America')]

# Filter out Hawaii
usa = north_america[north_america['name'] == 'United States of America']
usa = usa.explode(index_parts=True)  # Explode multipolygon geometries
continental_usa = usa[~usa.geometry.bounds.apply(lambda b: b['maxy'], axis=1).between(20, 30)]  # Remove Hawaii

# Combine with Canada and Mexico
canada_mexico = north_america[north_america['name'].isin(['Canada', 'Mexico'])]
north_america_filtered = pd.concat([continental_usa, canada_mexico])

# Plot the map
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(9, 6))
continental_usa.plot(ax=ax, color='#9357c6', alpha=.65)
ax.legend()
canada_mexico.plot(ax=ax, color='gray', alpha=0.3)

# Set the limits for x and y axes to zoom in on the area under y=55 and between x=-130 and 60
ax.set_xlim([-130, -60])
ax.set_ylim([20, 55])

# Hide axis tick marks and labels
ax.set_xticks([])
ax.set_yticks([])

# Extract boundaries
north_america_boundary = north_america.geometry.boundary

us_boundary = continental_usa.geometry.boundary.unary_union
canada_boundary = canada_mexico[canada_mexico['name'] == 'Canada'].geometry.boundary.unary_union
mexico_boundary = canada_mexico[canada_mexico['name'] == 'Mexico'].geometry.boundary.unary_union

# Find the intersection between US and Canada borders, and US and Mexico borders
us_canada_border = us_boundary.intersection(canada_boundary)
us_mexico_border = us_boundary.intersection(mexico_boundary)

# Plot US-Canada and US-Mexico borders
north_america.boundary.plot(ax=ax, color='black')
gpd.GeoSeries([us_canada_border]).plot(ax=ax, color='blue', linewidth=3, label='US-Canada Border')
gpd.GeoSeries([us_mexico_border]).plot(ax=ax, color='red', linewidth=3, label='US-Mexico Border')

# Add legend
ax.legend()

plt.title('The United States\'s Borders')
fig.figimage(logo, xo=fig.bbox.xmax-80, yo=fig.bbox.ymin+30, alpha=1)
plt.text(1, -.02, 'Illustration made by Max Sands', ha='right', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes, fontsize=8)
plt.tight_layout()

plt.savefig('images/united_states_borders.png', dpi=fig.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')

Code 
df = data['CBP Encounter by type + Region']
Code 
sub_df = df[df['Sub Var'] == 'Total']
sub_df = sub_df.replace('Total CBP', 'Total Encounters').drop(columns='Sub Var')
Code 
def number_format(val, pos):
    if val >= 1e12:
        return f'{val*1e-12:.0f}T'
    elif val >= 1e9:
        return f'{val*1e-9:.0f}B'
    elif val >= 1e6:
        return f'{val*1e-6:.0f}M'
    elif val >= 1e3:
        return f'{val*1e-3:.0f}k'
    else:
        return f'{val:.0f}'
Code 
# create canvas
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9,6))

# add lineplot
sns.lineplot(
    sub_df,
    x='Calendar Date',
    y='value',
    hue='Top Var',
    ax=ax,
    palette=colors[:3]
)

# modify x and y labels
ax.set(
    xlabel='',
    ylabel=''
)

# modify y axis ticker values
ax.yaxis.set_major_formatter(FuncFormatter(number_format))

# modify legend title
legend = ax.get_legend()
legend.set_title('')

# modify ticks and grid
ax.minorticks_on()
ax.grid(True, alpha=.2)

# annotate key dates
covid_date = pd.to_datetime('2020-01-20')
plt.annotate(
    'COVID-19',  # The text to display
    xy=(covid_date, 55000),  # Position to point to
    xytext=(pd.to_datetime('2019-09-30'),  150000),  # Position of the text label
    arrowprops=dict(facecolor='black', shrink=0.02, width=1),  # Arrow properties
    fontsize=10,
    color='black'
)

fig.figimage(logo, xo=fig.bbox.xmax-77, yo=60, alpha=1)
plt.text(1, -.08, 'Illustration made by Max Sands', ha='right', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes, fontsize=8)

plt.title('Border Encounters')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig('images/historical_border_encounters.png', dpi=fig.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
